Major_Arcs.title: The Enigma of Ghost Town and Imminent Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the mysterious setting of Ghost Town, the initial reactions of characters to its unusual authenticity, and the looming threat of its destruction for an airport.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Mystery in Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: This scene establishes the setting of Ghost Town and introduces the initial mystery as perceived by the Woman in Green Hat, contrasting past and present.

narrative_arcs.title: Woman's Internal Thoughts on Time Discrepancy

sub_scenes.title: Airport Construction Threat
sub_scenes.description: This scene reveals the modern reality of Ghost Town being Merrick Gulch and introduces the surveyors who are planning to demolish it for an airport, creating conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification of Ghost Town's Current State
Reaction to Airport Plan - Initial Shock and Disbelief

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Strain and Reactions to Ghost Town's Fate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc delves into the relationship dynamics of Nan and Cal, set against the backdrop of Ghost Town's impending demolition, exploring their romantic conflicts and differing perspectives.

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Dynamics of Nan and Cal
sub_scenes.description: This scene focuses on the conversation between Nan and Cal, revealing their romantic history, misunderstandings, and contrasting views on dreams and reality.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Perspective on Dreams and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Emotional Turmoil and Family Advice
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Nan's emotional distress due to the airport plan and her father's dismissive attitude, followed by comforting advice from her mother and maid regarding Cal's love.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation of Cal's Affection and Effort

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Resolve and Business Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This scene showcases Nan's internal resolve to seek clarity in her relationship with Cal and her immediate shift to handle business matters related to the airport construction and horses.

Major_Arcs.title: Business and Blizzard in Ghost Town Setting
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc combines the resolution of Nan and Cal's immediate relationship tension with the practicalities of the horse deal for the airport construction and transitions into a crisis caused by a severe blizzard, showcasing external challenges.

sub_scenes.title: Unresolved Feelings and Departure
sub_scenes.description: This scene portrays Nan and Cal's tense interaction where Nan confesses her deep feelings, but Cal remains somewhat distant and focused on duty, leading to a brief separation.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Cryptic Response
Passage of Time and Lingering Longing
Confession of Pursuit and Revealed Motivation

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Reunion and Blizzard's Approach
sub_scenes.description: This scene reunites Nan and Cal, focusing on Nan's confrontation about Cal's changed behavior and their emotional exchange, interrupted by the arrival of Mr. Wills with a grim weather report.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Confession about Changed Behavior
Indoor Discussion of Weather and Worry for Loved Ones
Cal's Determined Resolve and Acceptance of Responsibility

sub_scenes.title: Hay Lift and Hope
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the peak of the blizzard crisis and the arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift', bringing relief, renewed hope, and a sense of romantic resolution for Nan and Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollection of Restlessness and Expression of Hopelessness
Arrival of the Plane and Fodder Drop
Relief, Gratitude, and Renewed Hope with 'Operation Hay Lift'

Major_Arcs.title: Western Town Conflict - The Showdown
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts setting to a Western town and introduces a new conflict centered around a cowboy showdown, public reaction, and differing opinions on cowboy heroism and manners.

sub_scenes.title: Public Showdown and Initial Reactions
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts a public showdown in a Western town and captures the immediate varied reactions of the townspeople to the cowboy's actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense and Critique of Cowboy's Manners

Major_Arcs.title: Western Town Conflict - Differing Perspectives and Escalation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc continues exploring the Western town conflict, focusing on differing opinions about the cowboy's behavior, escalating tension between siblings Jeff and Sally, and introducing the ominous figure of Clyde Surrett.

sub_scenes.title: Bystander Commentary and Contrasting Views
sub_scenes.description: This scene showcases further reactions and discussions among bystanders, highlighting contrasting viewpoints on the cowboy and his actions, and introducing personal concerns.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense and Critique of Cowboy's Manners
Sally's Concern for Jeff's Hero Worship
Sally's Disappointment and Jeff's Clyde Surrett Defense
Jeff's Justification of Clyde Surrett and Dismissal of Chane Benson
Sally's Rejection of Jeff's Claims and Warning
Jeff's Threat and Sally's Fearful Response

Major_Arcs.title: Western Town Conflict - Resolution and Aftermath
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc resolves the conflict in the Western town, focusing on Sally's attempts to help Jeff, the intervention of Pete and Clyde, and the eventual confrontation and departure of Chane Benson, leading to a form of resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Help for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Sally's increasing worry about Jeff and her attempts to seek help from Clyde and Pete, highlighting her concern and desire for intervention.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and His Reassurance
Pete's Commitment to Helping Jeff and Sally's Appreciation
Pete's Flashback and Gun Advice to Young Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and His Humble Response

sub_scenes.title: Article Controversy and Benson's Stance
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces the controversy surrounding Clyde's article and Mr. Benson's reaction, setting up a conflict between journalistic integrity and potential danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Warning to Mr. Benson about Clyde's Anger
Mr. Benson's Dismissal of Danger and Confrontation with Sally
Mr. Benson's Justification for Staying in Town

sub_scenes.title: Clyde's Defiance and Sally's Reflection
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the escalating conflict surrounding Clyde's article, his defiance in the face of threats, and Sally's reflection on the situation and Jeff's admiration for Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Defense Regarding Clyde's Article
Background on Clyde's Defiant Actions and Consequences
Sally and Jeff's Discussion about Clyde and Benson's Conflict
Dinner Invitation and Evaluation of Chane's Skills

sub_scenes.title: Dinner and Rising Tension
sub_scenes.description: This scene covers the dinner invitation to Chane, the underlying tensions, Jeff's accusations towards Sally, and the escalating conflict between them.

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Intervention and Town Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Benson's violent intervention, his confrontation with Jeff, Sally's distress, and the resolution of the conflict with Benson leaving town due to the newspaper's influence.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Urgency and Chane's Pursuit of Clyde
Anticipation and Fear at the Door

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Arrival of Steve
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting at a ranch and a new set of characters, focusing on ranch troubles, the arrival of Steve Daley as a new boss, and initial suspicions and investigations.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Steve and Ranch Management
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Steve Daley and the ranch setting, focusing on initial impressions of Steve and the discussion of Betsy's ranch management capabilities.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Brawl and Rejection of Gunplay
Introducing Steve Daley and the New Boss
Confirmation of Betsy's Competence and Steve's Approval

sub_scenes.title: Suspicion and Investigation Plan
sub_scenes.description: This scene develops the dynamic between Steve and Betsy, introduces Hank's skepticism about Steve, and culminates in the reveal of ranch troubles and a plan to investigate.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Casual Acceptance and Betsy's Amusement
Hank's Skepticism and Betsy's Defense of Steve
Betsy's Accusation and Hank's Explanation of Ranch Troubles
Mutual Caution and Agreement to Investigate
Departure to Town and Buckboard Ride
Questioning Hank's Orders and Material for Dress

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Romance and Bridges Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc combines the developing romance between Betsy and Steve with an escalating conflict involving Fred Bridges, leading to a physical confrontation in town.

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation with Bridges
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Betsy and Steve's arrival in town and their immediate confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, escalating into a physical fight.

sub_scenes.title: Romance Blossoms Amidst Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This scene focuses on the developing romantic relationship between Betsy and Steve, despite ongoing conflicts, culminating in Steve's love confession and Betsy's conditional acceptance.

Major_Arcs.title: Bridges Conflict Resolution and Engagement
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc resolves the conflict with Fred Bridges, intensifies the ranch troubles, and culminates in Betsy and Steve's engagement amidst ongoing challenges.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Ranch Conflict and Investigation
sub_scenes.description: This scene escalates the ranch conflict with Bridges' complaint and his men's threats, leading to a deeper discussion about guns and Steve's past, setting up further action.

narrative_arcs.title: Valley Route Warning and Impending Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Engagement Amidst Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the emotional confrontation between Betsy and Steve, Steve's departure, Betsy's resolve to follow, and ultimately their engagement amidst the unresolved ranch troubles.

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Entanglement and Business Deal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new romantic plotline involving Carrie, Fred, and Dave, intertwined with business dealings and betrayals, culminating in Carrie's rejection of Fred after realizing his manipulative nature.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Injury
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the dramatic confrontation at Devil's Pass, Steve's revenge attempt, Betsy's intervention, and her subsequent injury, leading to a romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: New Romantic Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces a new romantic triangle involving Carrie, Dave, and Fred, setting up emotional conflicts and business-related tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dave and Father's Disapproval
Reflection on Morning Routine and Curley's Presence
Concern about Curley and Bear Fenin's Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Carrie and Fred - Romance to Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the escalating conflict over fencing and land, leading to a tense confrontation and the introduction of Curley, followed by Carrie's romantic involvement with Fred and her subsequent realization of his manipulative nature, culminating in her rejection.

narrative_arcs.title: Dispute Over Fencing and Grazing Land
Escalating Tension Over Fence and Water Access
Defensive Stance and Threat of Gunplay
Curley's Gun Draw and Impending Violence
Carrie and Dave Discussing Feelings and Fred

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Resolution at Carlton's Office
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Carrie's confrontation with Fred and Carlton at Carlton's office, leading to her emotional breakdown and Fred's ultimate defeat, resolving their immediate conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office

Major_Arcs.title: Final Romantic Resolution and Dirk's Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes the narrative by resolving Carrie's romantic conflicts and shifting focus to Chris and Rance's story, culminating in their marriage amidst past conflicts and Dirk's escape.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Reflection and Dave's Suspicion
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Carrie's reflection on her victory over Fred, a chance encounter with Dave, and Dave's lingering suspicion about Carrie's feelings for Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Fred's Defeat and Carrie's Victory
Chance Encounter and Casual Conversation at the Store
Inquiries About Fred and Confession of Love

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Wedding Preparations
sub_scenes.description: This scene resolves Carrie and Fred's romantic conflict with reconciliation and sets the stage for their wedding, transitioning to a new romantic narrative involving Chris and Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Concern and Arrival of Visitors
Rance's Reassurance and Readiness for Action

sub_scenes.title: Chris and Rance's Love Story and Dirk's Escape
sub_scenes.description: This scene unfolds Chris and Rance's love story, intertwined with Dirk's escape and the resolution of their legal and emotional conflicts, culminating in Chris and Rance's engagement and Dirk's departure to Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: Escalating Confrontation and Claim of Authority
Passage of Time and Acceptance of Reality
Re-emergence of Duty and Dirk's Fate
Moral Dilemma: Mercy Killing vs. Survival
Providing First Aid and Assessing Injury
Parting Ways and Concern for Criminal Escape
Plea to Return and Confession of Love
Rance's Self-Recrimination and Awareness of Burden
Concern for Riding and Inquiry about Dirk
Successful Escape to Mexico and Relief
Rance's Reassurance and Readiness for Action
